title: Adaptive SpikeDeep-Classifier: Self-organizing and self-supervised machine learning algorithm for online spike sorting. (arXiv:2304.01355v1 [q-bio.NC])
abstract: Objective. Research on brain-computer interfaces (BCIs) is advancing towards rehabilitating severely disabled patients in the real world. translated_title: 自适应SpikeDeep-分类器:用于实时脑机接口信号处理的自组织自监督机器学习算法
translated_abstract: 本研究旨在提高脑-计算机接口的解码效果，通过针对密集微电极阵列数据的处理，提出了一种自适应自组织算法——自适应SpikeDeep-分类器(Ada-SpikeDeepClassifier)。该算法使用SpikeDeeptector进行信道选择，采用自适应背景活动拒绝器(Ada-BAR)进行信号预处理，并采用自监督在线聚类模块(OCM)进行分类。Ada-SpikeDeep-Classifier在模拟和实际数据记录中均表现出高精度和强健性，优于现有的算法。该算法可望扩展到神经科学和机器学习社区的其他神经数据分析任务中。
tldr: Ada-SpikeDeep-Classifier是一种用于实时脑机接口信号处理的自适应自组织算法，它使用了SpikeDeeptector进行信道选择、Ada-BAR进行信号预处理、OCM进行分类，旨在提高脑-计算机接口的解码效果，并在实验中表现出高精度和强健性。
en_tdlr: Ada-SpikeDeep-Classifier is an adaptive and self-organized algorithm for online spike sorting in brain-computer interfaces. It uses SpikeDeeptector for channel selection, Ada-BAR for signal preprocessing, and self-supervised Online Clustering Module (OCM) for classification. It showed high accuracy and robustness in spike sorting, outperforming state-of-the-art algorithms. This technique is a promising approach for improving decoding of user intentions and can be extended to other neural data analysis tasks in both neuroscience and machine learning communities.
